intro: Lippia obovata, commonly known as Mexican mint or winter mint, is a perennial herb native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves that emit a strong mint-like scent. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with opposite, ovate to obovate leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pale purple flowers are clustered in terminal spikes and bloom during the warmer months. Lippia obovata is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its refreshing aroma and medicinal properties.
